author: Staff Reporter
text:
By cost reduction, only Micro Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) can compete with both domestic and international market, said D. Ravichandar, chief executive officer of Jindal Steel Works Limited (Salem-Works), here recently.

At the valediction of the productivity week celebrations, organised by the Salem Productivity Council, on ‘Ease of doing business of Higher Productivity and Sustainable Growth’, he said that cost reduction alone would help prevail in the competitive market. The long-term focus by doing right things by focusing on good results would retain the customers permanently subject to satisfaction of the products and customer relationship management. He said that generating employment opportunities for over a lakh of graduates every year was not possible and added that MSME sector provided maximum of 10 crore employment opportunities in which one crore was provided in Tamil Nadu.

K. Mariappan, vice-president, TANSTSIA, Coimbatore Region welcomed the gartering while S. Govindan, Secretary of Salem Productivity council explained the celebrations. Dr. Arthanari, managing director, Gokulam Hospitals Private Limited, pointed out that the entire modernised upgraded medical treatment were navigated by the contribution of technocrats and engineers, responsible for designing and manufacturing all the equipment. R. Sudaram, chief executive officer, Aerospace Engineering, also spoke.
title: ‘MSMEs create more job opportunities’
